neighbors.name: Jose Luis Lopez
neighbors.claims: Jose Luis Lopez is listed as the owner of Maricopa County parcel 400-35-005[Maricopa County Assessor's Office](https://maps.mcassessor.maricopa.gov/help/t_search.html)】. No mentions of Lopez in local news or public meeting records were found, and he holds no known public positions[Maricopa County Assessor's Office](https://maps.mcassessor.maricopa.gov/help/t_search.html)】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a personal visit to learn his concerns and explain project benefits in a one-on-one conversation.

neighbors.name: Christian J. Munoz

Research yielded no public remarks by Munoz about development, and he is not listed in any local civic roles[Maricopa County Assessor's Office](https://maps.mcassessor.maricopa.gov/help/t_search.html)】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage him directly (e.g., at his residence) to hear any concerns and to share information, building trust through personal outreach.

neighbors.name: Brian Vaughn Santos Tuncap Jr and Nicole Marie Rodriguez
neighbors.claims: County records identify Brian V. S. Tuncap Jr. and Nicole M. Rodriguez as co-owners of parcel 400-35-399 in Maricopa County[Maricopa County Assessor's Office](https://maps.mcassessor.maricopa.gov/help/t_search.html)】. They have no documented public statements on local development, nor any evident positions in community organizations[Maricopa County Assessor's Office](https://maps.mcassessor.maricopa.gov/help/t_search.html)】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to them in person as neighbors, focusing on open communication and addressing any questions or concerns they may have about the project.

overview_summary: None of the three profiled neighbors have a documented public stance on development or clean energy, as no statements or actions were found. All three appear to be private residents with low community influence, lacking any known official roles or notable public presence.
